{"step_by_step_thinking": "The chance for bone fill depends on the number of bony walls surrounding the defect. The more walls a defect has, the better the chance for bone fill. This is because the walls provide a scaffold for new bone to grow. Therefore, a 3-walled defect would offer a better chance for bone fill than a 2-walled defect, an osseous crater, or a hemisepta.", "answer_choice": "A"}
